toc_entry.title: Drug Lord
toc_entry.description: There are three secrets to Miguel Felix Gallardo’s multimillion-dollar empire of drugs and power. Corruption, corruption, and corruption.

toc_entry.title: I’ve Been Rich And I’ve Been Poor
toc_entry.description: The fond memories and hard times of a postboom oil heiress.

toc_entry.title: Hold the Ants!
toc_entry.description: From smoked chicken salad to Kahlua s’mores, our summer picnic sampler has a spread for you.

toc_entry.title: The Best And the Worst Legislators
toc_entry.description: We just rate them. You voted for them.

toc_entry.title: i Arriba! Lou Diamond Phillips?
toc_entry.description: This former Mr. Flour Bluff High School has what Hollywood wants—ethnic diversity.

toc_entry.title: Donald Curry Vs. The World
toc_entry.description: All boxers are wary in the ring, where defeat is only a well-placed punch away. But Donald Curry knows that the real terrors of boxing lie beyond the ropes.

toc_entry.title: Go Up, Young Man
toc_entry.subtitle: Travel
toc_entry.description: These tall office towers, observatories, and revolving restaurants offer inspiring views of Texas’ cityscapes.

toc_entry.title: Sorry, Mom
toc_entry.subtitle: Food
toc_entry.description: Even your mother can’t top Rex Hale’s light-as-a-cloud shortcake.

toc_entry.title: New Age Cyrano
toc_entry.subtitle: Movies
toc_entry.description: While Roxanne is steeped in friendliness, Summer Heat is full of humid cliches; Personal Services is too pleased with itself, but The Big Easy has a hang-loose, big-spender quality.

toc_entry.title: Oil Gluttons
toc_entry.subtitle: Books
toc_entry.description: Getty Oil dropped into the market like raw steak into a bay full of sharks; Oil and Honor clarifies the waters. Beverly Lowry keeps the pages turning in her deft and racy roman a clef, The Perfect Sonya.

toc_entry.title: Singing All the Way
toc_entry.subtitle: Classical Music
toc_entry.description: Mary Jane Johnson and Timothy Jenkins live in amarillo, but they’re at home in the world’s great opera houses.

toc_entry.title: The Roar Of the Crowd
toc_entry.description: Coot sightings, judgment calls, AIDS awareness.

toc_entry.title: Around the State
toc_entry.description: A selective guide to amusements and events.

toc_entry.title: Reporter
toc_entry.description: Not much happened at the Legislature, but that doesn’t mean they left no traces. Plus: Houston’s i’m OK, We’re OK Wortham bash, unlikely Texas TV stars, and Frank Lorenzo’s flight to cushier climes.

toc_entry.title: The National Tour Of Texas
toc_entry.description: Back from the Gulf and along its coastal bend, picture-book towns offer scenes that have nearly vanished from urban Texas, not to mention the most confusing sign, the best noontime stop, and the most Shakespearean site.

toc_entry.title: State Secrets
toc_entry.description: Fort Worth factions fight over expanding the zoo; Galvestonians derail a tourist trolley; Mattox’s political plans go awry.
